setting.name: Modem VID
setting.description: Set the PAN (Personal Area Network) ID for the network. Valid range is 0-0xFFFF

setting.name: Operating Channel
setting.description: Set/read the operating channel number (Uses 802.15.4 channel numbers).

setting.name: Mac Retries
setting.description: Set/read maximum number of Mac level RF packet delivery attempts of unicasts. If RR is non-zero packets sent from the radio will request an acknowledgement, and can be resent up to RR times if no acknowledgements are received.

setting.name: Multi-Transmit
setting.description: Set/read number of additional broadcast retransmissions. All broadcast packets are transmitted MT+1 times to ensure it is received.

setting.name: Broadcast Radius
setting.description: Set/Read the transmission radius for broadcast data transmissions. Set to 0 for maximum radius. If BH is set greater than NH then the value of NH is used.

setting.name: Mesh Retries
setting.description: Set/read maximum number of network packet delivery attempts. If MR is non-zero, packets sent will request a network acknowledgement, and can be resent up to MR times if no acknowledgements are received.

setting.name: Network Hops
setting.description: Set/read maximum number of hops across the network. This number does not limit # of hops; rather, it is used to calculate maximum network traversal time and must be set the same on all nodes in the network.

setting.name: Network Delay Slots
setting.description: Set/read the maximum number of delay slots before rebroadcasting a network packet.

setting.name: Coordinator Enable
setting.description: Set/read the network type. End Devices will not propogate broadcasts and will not become an intermediate node on a route.

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: Read high 32 bits of modems unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address.

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: Read low 32 bits of modems unique IEEE 64-bit Extended Address.

setting.name: Destination Address High
setting.description: Set/read the upper 32 bits of the 64 bit destination extended address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address.

setting.name: Destination Address Low
setting.description: Set/read the lower 32 bits of the 64 bit destination extended address. 0x000000000000FFFF is the broadcast address.

setting.name: Node Identifier
setting.description: Set/read Node Identifier string

setting.name: Node Discovery Backoff
setting.description: Set/read Node Discovery backoff register. This sets the maximum delay for Node Discovery responses to be sent (ND, DN).

setting.name: Node Discovery Options
setting.description: Sets the node discovery options register. Options include 0x01-Append DD value to end of node discovery, 0x02-Return devices own ND response first

setting.name: Device Type Identifier
setting.description: Set/read the device type identifier value. This can be used to differentiate multiple XBee-based products.

setting.name: Encryption Enable
setting.description: Enable or disable 128-bit AES encryption.

setting.name: AES Encryption Key
setting.description: Sets the 128-bit key used for encryption and decryption. This register cannot be read.

setting.name: Baud Rate
setting.description: Set/read the serial interface baud rate for communication between modem serial port and host. Request non-standard baud rates with values above 0x80 using a terminal window. Read BD register to find actual baud rate achieved.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: Configure parity for the UART.

setting.name: DIO7 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO7 line of the module.

setting.name: DIO6 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO6 line of the module.

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: Set/read the flow control threshold. De-assert CTS when FT bytes are in the UART receive buffer.

setting.name: AD0/DIO0 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD0/DIO0 line of the module. Options include: Enabling commissioning button functionality, Analog to Digital converter,Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD1/DIO1 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD1/DIO1 line of the module. Options include: Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD2/DIO2 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD2/DIO2 line of the module. Options include: Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD3/DIO3 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD3/DIO3 line of the module. Options include: Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD4/DIO4 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD4/DIO4 line of the module. Options include: Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: AD5/DIO5/Assoc. Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the AD5/DIO5/Assoc. line of the module. Options include: Associated LED indicator (blinks when associated), Analog to Digital converter, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO8/SLEEP_RQ Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO8 line of the module. Options include: Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO9/ON_SLEEP Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO9 line of the module. Options include: ON/SLEEP Indicator, Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO10/RSSI/PWM0 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO10/RSSI/PWM0 line of the module. Options include: RSSI PWM Output, PWM0 Output, Digital Input, and Output.

setting.name: DIO11/PWM1 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO11/PWM1 line of the module. Options include: PWM1 Output, Digital Input, and Output.

setting.name: DIO12 Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO12 line of the module. Options include: Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: DIO13/DOUT Configuration
setting.description: Configure options for the DIO13 line of the module. Options include: Digital Input and Output.

setting.name: PWM0 duty cycle
setting.description: Set/read the duty cycle of the PWM0 line (pin 6)

setting.name: PWM1 duty cycle
setting.description: Set/read the duty cycle of the PWM1 line (pin 7)

setting.name: Associate LED Blink Time
setting.description: Set/read the Associate LED blink rate. This value determines the blink rate of the Associate/DIO5 pin if D5=1 and the module has started a network. Setting LT to 0 will use the default blink time (250ms).

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: Set/read PWM timer register. Set duration of PWM (pulse width modulation) signal output on the RSSI pin (P6). The signal duty cycle is updated with each received packet and is shut off when the timer expires.

setting.name: Pull-up Resistor Enable
setting.description: Set/read bitfield to configure internal pullup resistors status for I/O lines. 1=internal pullup enabled, 0=no internal pullup. Bitfield map: (14)-Dout, (13)-DIO7, (12)-DIO11, (11)-DIO10/PWM0, (10)-DIO12, (9)-On/Sleep, (8)Associate, (7)-DIN/Config, (6)-Sleep_Rq, (5)-RTS, (4)-AD0/DIO0, (3)-AD1/DIO1, (2)-AD2/DIO2, (1)-AD3/DIO3, (0)-DIO4

setting.name: DIO Change Detect
setting.description: Set/Read bitfield values for change detect monitoring.Each bit enables monitoring of DIO0-DIO12 for changes. If detected, data is transmitted with DIO data only.

setting.name: Sample Rate
setting.description: Set/read sample rate. When set this parameter causes the modem to sample all enabled DIO and ADC at a specified interval.

setting.name: Sample From Sleep Rate
setting.description: Set/read the number of sleep cycles that must elapse between periodic IO samples. This allows IO samples to be taken only during some wake cycles. During those cycles IO samples are taken at the rate specified by IR.

setting.name: AT Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: Set/read command mode timeout parameter. If no valid commands have been received within this time period, modem returns to Idle Mode from AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Guard Times
setting.description: Set required period of silence before, after and between the Command Mode Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (GT + CC + GT). The period of silence is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into AT Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: Set/read character value to be used to break from data mode to command mode. The default value (0x2B) is the ASCII code for the plus ('+') character.

setting.name: Last Packet Rssi
setting.description: Read the RSSI of the last received packet.

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read modem firmware version number.

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Read modem hardware version number.

setting.name: Receive Error Count
setting.description: Set/read number of RF Packets rejected because of bit errors in packet.

setting.name: Receive Good Count
setting.description: Set/read number of RF Packets successfully received.

setting.name: Delivery Failure Count
setting.description: Read number of RF packets sent where retries expire with no ACK received (when RR>0)

setting.name: Unicasts Attempted Count
setting.description: Set/read number of unicasts sent expecting an acknowledgement (when RR>0)

setting.name: Number of MAC ACK timeouts
setting.description: Set/read number of unicasts that timed out awaiting a MAC ACK (Can be up to RR+1 timeouts per unicast when RR>0)

setting.name: Number of bytes transmitted
setting.description: Set/read number of RF bytes transmitted. Every byte of every packet is counted, including PHY headers and trailers

setting.name: Missed Sleep Synch Count
setting.description: Read number of sleep cycles in which a sleep synch has not been received.

setting.name: Configuration Code
setting.description: Read the configuration code associated with the current AT command configuration.

setting.name: Maximum Number of RF Payload Bytes
setting.description: Read the maximum number of RF payload bytes that can be sent in a single RF transmission.

setting.name: Power Level
setting.description: Select/Read transmitter output power.

setting.name: Wake Host Delay
setting.description: Set/read the time the module will delay before sending serial data out the UART or taking IO samples after waking from sleep. This can be used to give a sleeping host processor sufficient time to power up after the module asserts the ON_SLEEP line.

setting.name: Sleep Options
setting.description: Bitfield of options for a sleep compatible node. Bit 0-Preferred Sleep Coord. Setting this bit will cause a sleep compatible node to always act as sleep coordinator. Bit 1-Non-Sleep Coord. will cause a node to never act as a sleep coordinator. Bit 2-Enable API sleep status messages. Bit 3-Disable automatic early wakeup for missed synchs. Bit 4-Disable seniority based on node type. Bit 5-Disable coordinator rapid sync deployment mode. Bit 8-Always wake for ST time.

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Normal mode is always awake. Pin sleep modes allow the module to be woken with the SLEEP_RQ line. Asynchronous cyclic mode sleeps for SP time and briefly wakes, checking for activity. Sleep Support mode is always awake but can effectively communicate with SM8 nodes. Synchronized Cyclic Sleep nodes sleep for SP and wake for ST time. Synchronous modes are not compatible with asynchronous modes.

setting.name: Sleep Status
setting.description: Bitfield of sleep status bits. See product manual for full description. Bits only apply to synchronous sleep radios. Bit 0-Is network awake? Bit 1-Is sleep coordinator? Bit 2-Ever received synch? Bit 3-RX synch this cycle? Bit 4-Overriding synch pending? Bit 5-Nomination Requested? Bit 6-Is in deployment mode? (All other bits are reserved and should be ignored)

setting.name: Operating Sleep Time
setting.description: Read the current network sleep time that this node is synchronized to, in units of 10 milliseconds. If this node has not been synched then OS will return the value of SP.

setting.name: Operating Wake Time
setting.description: Read the current network wake time that this node is synchronized to, in units of milliseconds. If this node has not been synched then OW will return the value of ST.

setting.name: Missed Synch Messages
setting.description: Read the number of sleep/wake cycles since the node received a synch message.

setting.name: Number of Cycles to power down IO
setting.description: Set/read the number of cyclic sleep cycles the On/Sleep pin should remain low during cyclic sleep. This allows an external app to sleep longer than max SP time. Set to 1 to set On/Sleep high after each SP time (default). Only valid in asynchronous cyclic sleep modes.

setting.name: Sleep Time
setting.description: Set/read the sleep time of the module.

setting.name: Wake Time
setting.description: Set/read the wake time of the module. For synchronous sleep modules minimum wake time is a function of SP, NN, NH, and platform dependent values. Value will be raised automatically to a valid value when SP, NN, NH are increased. Maximum value is an hour (or 0x36ee80 ms).
